result.title: EU-US Twinning Lab
result.description: The Lab will be manifested through a software platform extending the community creation efforts of the NGI4All and NGI-Forward projects. The purpose is to provide automated matching of EU actors with US actors (and vice versa) to align complementarities and research activities in establishing multi-partner groupings around defined NGI challenges.

result.title: Experimental and theoretical description of the quantum plasmon in dSNCs
result.description: Spectroscopic investigation: i) standard steady-state investigation; ii) ultrafast measurements; iii) near-field scanning microscopy and scattering-scanning near-field optical microscopy (S-SNOM) capable of probing single particle LSPR. Theoretical evaluation: i) Multi-scale theoretical models; ii) numerical tools and simulations; iii) density functional theory, tight-binding, empirical FT and local density approximation (LDA) procedures used to calculate the groundstate; iV) time-dependent LDA (TDLDA), based on the random phase approximation (RPA), to compute absorption spectra.

project.title: Localized Surface Plasmon Resonance in doped semiconductor nanocrystals

result.title: CloudButton Prototype of Abstractions, Fault-tolerance and Porting Tools
result.description: This deliverable depends on the Serverless Compute Engine design (D3.1), as well as the programming abstractions built to deal with mutable state (D4.1). It will include an implementation of a significant portion of the mark-up annotations and custom data structures, evaluated via two prototypes of non-trivial big data and machine-learning problems. These prototypes will demonstrate automatically parallelized Java code based on stateful dataflow graphs, processed and executed on CloudButton. A simple fault-tolerance mechanism and associated configuration mechanism will also be provided.

result.title: Platform software architecture - version I
result.description: Provides the global platform design (services, APIs), and defines the resources provisioning plan addressing the partner needs, together with the related operational scenarios. Together wtih D1.6, this deliverable will include new versions of the Hops Data platform with support for the features defined in Task 1.1, including erasure-coded replication, support for lower-resolution satellite image files in the metadata layer.

result.title: Initial specs of the Serverless Compute and Execution Engine
result.description: This deliverable includes initial specifications and design of the Serverless Compute and Execution Engine. During the first six months of the project an assessment of the leading open source serverless technologies, such as Apache OpenWhisk, PyWren, OpenFaaS, nuclio, and other, will be performed. The results of this assessment will be reported in the specification and design document and an initial prototype will be built on the best of breed technology with the highest potential for impact.

result.title: Serverless Compute Engine Design and Prototypes
result.description: This deliverable describes the Serverless Compute and Execution Engine software components. It also includes initial monitoring and instrumentation efforts to acquire telemetry and log data for the workloads across various services using real experiments. The collected data will be used to validate the software and to identify candidate performance improvements and I/O problems. Finally, it also includes a performance evaluation study on the data from the use cases.

result.title: CloudButton Initial API Definition
result.description: This deliverable includes a detailed definition of the exact abstractions and API we will be exposing. It will outline the methods by which users can mark up their code for parallelization as well pseudocode sketches of how all the custom data structures will behave. The deliverable will also provide initial observations on the complexity of the porting tools we have proposed, including experiments with static analysis and an audit of the required OpenMP and MPI functionality.
